title: To the people complaining S's are too hard to get:
body:
I just went 0/4/0 and got an A- on an ADC champ.

How? Because I tried to cs, took towers, and warded. Your k/d/a is NOT the only thing that's important in a game. Far from it. So stop posting your silly "omg i went 13-10-2 no S but so many kills rito fix broken system" threads.

Edit: Or you can just fucking ball out as Soraka.

http://i.imgur.com/UyJ2IPO.jpg

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2256148004/234239441?tab=overview

replies.body:
CS matters more than anything else, oddly. 40 CS is often the difference between A- and S-, in otherwise identical games.
Why riot weights CS so heavily, i dont know.

because CS is one of the most important things in the game. If you're ahead of the enemy laner by 20 cs, even if they got a kill on you, you're going to be ahead in gold. There's a reason pros focus so much on farming

Sure, CS is important, but you can be 5000 CS up on someone who has only 20 CS, and you being 0/4/0 means your CS was useless because you never did anything with it. Even if you took a couple towers, you were clearly not present in any teamfights. If you won that game, it was because you got carried or the enemy team royally fucked up moreso than you having any real impact.

CS isnt the only thing in the game.
I'm confused. How would taking objectives not be helping the team? Teamfights and kills mean absolutely nothing if you don't use them to take objectives.

Because then the enemy team can just 5v4 your team and win the game. A score of 0/4/0 signifies that you werent with your team. At all.

So either 

1) your team carried without you, making you meaningless in the game.

or 

2) The enemy team misplayed and refused to capitalize on you not being around your team. 

Either way, the win wasnt because of some divine greatness on the persons part. You can have all the CS in the world, and if you dont use it properly it wont matter.
You fail to understand: it is possible to win a game of league of legends without getting a single kill

Possible =/= plausible/realistic. You can win off 0 kills in bronze 5. You cant win off 0 kills in higher elos as an adc unless your team hard carried you.

Any teamfight you would be a part in would have been a loss (0 kills and 0 assists). If you attempted to split push all day your team would lose fights 4v5, and 5 people can base race better than you.

The entire principle behind what you're trying to say is incorrect because clearly, getting an A-, OP did something right. There is NO 'necessity' for an marksman to carry a game and besides that, getting kills is NOT the ONLY way to carry. Getting tons of CS, towers and objectives alone is benefit enough to your team and can be considered a form of carrying.

Getting an A- does not mean that you did something right. You could have played like trash, the grading system is *not* perfect, its an algorithm that takes into account how other people in your skill level do on a champ in said role.

0/4/0. You were worthless to your team. There is no arguing against this statement. 

Your team won the game without you regardless (you were in 0 teamfights, meaning the enemy team could just walk allll over your team and win the game. Since this didnt happen, its logical to assume your team won without you, making your presense irrelevant. You could have just AFKd the entire game)

CS and gold is irrelevant if you never show up to a teamfight. An ADC is not a split pusher.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-03T16:37:42.807+0000)
>
>  An ADC is not a split pusher.

Anything that helps your team win is a worthy contribution, is it not? Just because in that match, the ADC did not do what a typical ADC does in order to win matches does not mean that ADC played badly. 

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-03T16:37:42.807+0000)
>
>  CS and gold is irrelevant if you never show up to a teamfight

Here lies the whole fallacy: you say CS does not mean anything if you don't get kills, yet _kills mean even less if you don't win the game._ You can have a team of five assassins that ends up with three times as many kills as the other team, but in the end, if they do not manage objectives and the goal of the game, they will not win.

TL;DR: Kills help you win but a) they are not the only factor that helps you win and b) they do not directly bring you closer to the ultimate objective of the game, which other factors may do.

The point

------------

Your head

Again. 0/4/0. Meaning he was not relevant in any teamfight. Meaning his team was, at maximum, 4v5 the entire game. You could sit in base and afk all game if your team is winning teamfights 4v5.

I've repeated this so many times that I am genuinely surprised at either a) how troll you are or b) how you have not picked up on this and at least commented on it. 

So what if he did not join any team fight? You're putting an ENORMOUS emphasis on getting kills, but ask yourself: _does getting kills get you physically closer to the nexus?_ Sure, it is very useful to get kills, but **there ARE OTHER ways in which one could contribute to a victory.**

In bronze, sure. In a real ELO you arent going to just get objectives for free with 5 enemies on the map, especially since youre the ADC and are the majority of your team's damage potential.

Show bot? Enemy now has baron, is grouped mid/top, and just aced your team for free. Have fun base-racing against 5 enemy champs + baron.

Face it, the only way physically possible for someone to win a game as 0/4/0 is if they were entirely irrelevant.

ADCs are the main damage source of a team. Your team doesnt have theirs, and its a full 4v5. Unless this was bronze queue, that WILL be punished severely.

And its not possible for your team to take it due to splitpush pressure. The moment you show bot side, typically nowhere even near a tower, the enemy will rush baron. Meaning either their team gets baron, or your team gets 4v5d to stop baron. Guess who wins that either way? 

The only two realistic scenarios is that either this queue was bronze and the enemy team had 0 idea how to rotate and punish clear bad play, or their team was so far ahead that they didnt matter at all in any fights. Either way, they contributed nothing to the win.
Why are you under the assumption that split pushing led to an ace? About Baron, it is entirely possible for the rest of her team to take it due to split push pressure
Once in a while I have simply pushed the game for the win when my teammates are fighting in botlane.. Objectives over kills. ALWAYS.

> [{quoted}](name=dynikus,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-08-02T00:43:05.768+0000)
>
> because CS is one of the most important things in the game. If you're ahead of the enemy laner by 20 cs, even if they got a kill on you, you're going to be ahead in gold. There's a reason pros focus so much on farming

since the bse value of a kill is 300 gold without bounties 15 cs is a kill in gold last i checked
Because it's extremely important. I've been behind in kills on their adc, but have put out a lot more damage simply by having a huge cs lead, leading to an item lead.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-02T00:41:31.137+0000)
>
> CS matters more than anything else, oddly. 40 CS is often the difference between A- and S-, in otherwise identical games.
> Why riot weights CS so heavily, i dont know.

CS is probably not directly considered. It probably uses your gold as a way to determine your grade. Thing is, most people don't realize that CS grants more gold than a few kills. Remember champion kill rewards go down on champions that die consecutively but minion gold goes up as the game progresses. You get more gold from 100 CS than you would from killing Annie 5 times in a row.
100 CS is worth approximately 6.25 kills, if the "16 CS = 1 kill" rule still applies.
Do you know if CS is ignored or weighted less for Support grades?
i honestly bet its weighted. shouldn't be but Riot has been kinda dumb this year...
Supports get less CS and less gold, so of course it is weighted less.
meanwhile i got 4 dragons and 2 barons on Skarner, with a decent KDA. Got a B... you would think that would atleast be an A right? people in chat were even telling me i got screwed
I went 18/3/6 with 255 cs with kat but only s- :(
Depends on how long the game is lol. 255 cs in a 55 min game isn't that good. You also probably could have warded more, took more objectives.
Yea i agree with you but its pretty hard to keep up with cs especially with kat
Well you are judged against the average Kat lol.
Yeh, kata actually has quite a nice wave clear... Not _that_ hard

i just got nasus to mastery seven. one of the games i did i wasnt doing to well in the kills department and finished the game like 2/8/8 but i had double any ones elses cs. and i took every tower in the game. i got S
i went 30/6/11 with hec literally solo carried my team but a+. Kinda sucks you still need to cs when your farming kills.

Your argument doesnt do anything other than show the system has flaws.

1) You didnt list what champ

2) 0/4/0 should never have been an A- unless you took 5 towers solo and all 3 inhibs. Your CS is pointless if you do literally fuck all with it.

3) The weight of different grades might not be the same. Clearly  getting an A- is easier than an S. To which extent is unknown.

1) It doesn't matter what champion. Same applies for any ADC (outside of probably Urgod).

2) I did take many towers and inhibs :)

3) Obviously getting an A- is easier than an S. Point being that you can get close to getting an S with a 0.0 KDA just by doing other things.

1) It matters. How you rank is dependent on what champ and role you pick. If you pick Soraka ADC, its easier to get an S+ than Cait ADC, as no one plays soraka ADC for it to match you up against.

2) Did you take 5+ towers and all 3 inhibs? If not, then you dont deserve the A, you werent relevant to your team at all. Your team was winning the game without you.

3) You missed the point; theres no way of knowing if an A is remotely close to an S. Youre assuming the scale is linear, and can be defined as the same distance between grades, instead of some other grading system where the difference between an A+ and an S- is the same as the discance from B- to A+.
"On an ADC champ" means not Soraka. I would have just said, "playing ADC".

My largest complaint is if youre a tank, and you have the highest kill participation, few deaths (less than 4) and high dmg taken with decent dmg dealth, i think that should scale out some of the cs you need. if you have 80% kp of 40 kills with double the dmg taken of anyone else on your team, then why do you get an A- because you have 150 cs at 25 minutes instead of 250
You're judged against the average for that champ at that position. So maybe the champ you're playing is Ekko. So you're OP as fuck, typically have 80% kp anyway, and have btr cs :)

> [{quoted}](name=I Go Pew Pew Pew,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=00110000,timestamp=2016-08-03T13:44:10.887+0000)
>
> You're judged against the average for that champ at that position. So maybe the champ you're playing is Ekko. So you're OP as fuck, typically have 80% kp anyway, and have btr cs :)

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2256898749/217753639?tab=overview

this is most specifically what im referring to. High dmg, good warding (most pinks used, saved carries countless times from rengar), good dmg taken, highest kill participation (it's actually really good for soloq in general) and maybe 50-60 cs below average but my team wouldve lost every fight if i wasn't there so lose the game and get S- or win the game for A. I'll take my A even though it was the best decision at the time.

I've done significantly worse all around but had better cs and gotten an S+. I just don't think it's fully balanced, I'm not complaining bc i know how to get an S, it just could use some tweaks for Damage Taken and Kill Particiaption for more supportive roles like tanks.

Also healing done and damage mitigated should weigh in to a grade for supports like soraka and janna

>so lose the game and get S- or win the game for A. I'll take my A even though it was the best decision at the time.

I agree with this.

What I will say is that Zac is really strong. People tend to do really well with him. So they could be right up there with your kill participation and have other things. Such as better cs or maybe more tower/inhib kills. Like I said, it's judged against the average for your champ/role. So saying it needs tweaks for roles like tanks, I don't necessarily agree with. Since it's not comparing your cs as a tank to your cs as an ADC. It's comparing your Zac jungle cs to other Zac junglers.

> [{quoted}](name=I Go Pew Pew Pew,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=0011000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-03T13:51:33.894+0000)
>
> I agree with this.
> 
> What I will say is that Zac is really strong. People tend to do really well with him. So they could be right up there with your kill participation and have other things. Such as better cs or maybe more tower/inhib kills. Like I said, it's judged against the average for your champ/role. So saying it needs tweaks for roles like tanks, I don't necessarily agree with. Since it's not comparing your cs as a tank to your cs as an ADC. It's comparing your Zac jungle cs to other Zac junglers.

This is silver, let's be honest with ourselves. No one is getting an average of 75% KP. It needs tweaks as in, the cs should scale down, the more involved you are in other aspects of the game. I understand I'm being compared to other Zacs but in that particular match, it was stop afk farming or lose the game. 31 Kill Participation with a huge amount of damage taken at 33 minutes should mitigate some of the cs requirement because unlike most people in Silver I decided that what my team needed was help and not a jungler spamming his camps. It (the cs requirement) should decrease inversely with your (kill participation / length of match)

I'm not sure that you're based on silver alone. I could be wrong about that, though.

Also, you keep saying to decrease the cs requirement if you have more damage taken, etc. I'm saying that other Zacs STILL have your other stats AND have higher cs. That's what you're judged against. The average Zac does not. Obviously. That's why you got a high rating. But the top Zacs DO. That's why you didn't get the top rating. I'm not sure how else to describe this to you.

> [{quoted}](name=I Go Pew Pew Pew,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=001100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-03T14:01:24.614+0000)
>
> I'm not sure that you're based on silver alone. I could be wrong about that, though.
> 
> Also, you keep saying to decrease the cs requirement if you have more damage taken, etc. I'm saying that other Zacs STILL have your other stats AND have higher cs. That's what you're judged against. The average Zac does not. Obviously. That's why you got a high rating. But the top Zacs DO. That's why you didn't get the top rating. I'm not sure how else to describe this to you.

I don't think you fully understand. I could pass the best Zac in every single all around field EXCEPT if I'm under the average Zac cs i can not get an S. The fact that i didnt get an S doesnt mean I underperformed compared to them in every field. It means i underperformed in at least 1

That's just a false statement. I have gotten plenty of S ratings even if I didn't have the best CS. CS is important, but it certainly is NOT the only factor. But you obviously have your own thoughts and do not have an open mind, so have a good day.
I went 0/1/1 as Heimer and got an S. Best game of my life.
Link this to me I have to see this omg
Not totally sure how I would show it to you. I didn't screencap it at the time, although I should've. I'll try to find some way.
Do you have it in match history?
No, it was a while ago. At least a few months.

> [{quoted}](name=I Go Pew Pew Pew,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=8uea3Ryx,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-08-02T00:37:28.902+0000)
>
> I just went 0/4/0 and got an A- on an ADC champ.
> 
> How? Because I tried to cs, took towers, and warded. Your k/d/a is NOT the only thing that&#039;s important in a game. Far from it. So stop posting your silly &quot;omg i went 13-10-2 no S but so many kills rito fix broken system&quot; threads.

Their is way too many factors that can screw ball things.
-CS farming
-Kills, Deaths, Assist ratios
-Taking Objectives
-The role your in
-The average bar people have basically set for said champion, especially with the role it is standing in.

Funny how with a Ryze i manage to get a S rank not by simply being a over'all bad arse player, but by taking advantage of his wave clear and easily push 10 to 30 minion sized waves that flooded the the top lane on occassion and manage to hit over 300+ CS in late game by taking  the time to focus more on controlling lanes, side pushing turrets down while the rest of my team was able to hold down the middle lane rush.

Its funny how the argument of 'be a team player' can easily be shut down by taking the time to focus on more important things, especially when you dont need your entire team sieging and it would be better to keep some spread around to intercept the ridiculous split push screw offs where a few players will pratically kite you to siege there base while the ADCS or other high damage champions will sneak thru the jungle to a pushed up lane to quickly rush it down and get straight to the inhibitor in a few seconds.

I will admit at least that some factors need to be less influential and/or have more impact straight on getting a S rank, since i've had too many moments on A and A- when i performed a excellent game itself, but sometimes it gets cut short by the constant use of surrendering or the flip side of we get snowballed and locked inside our base while the enemy steals all the objectives as if they were some korean perfectionist pro team(in a exaggerated sense). Such as champion 'bars' being set by a player average being less influential and more along hitting a 'particular number' on CS, Turret destruction involvement and less your a jungler, taking objectives being a helpful bonus factor in upping your score in getting an S rank.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
